reviews.text: Has the atmosphere of a country-house hotel in the tropics. Spread over 12 acres of glorious gardens, it delivers graceful, old-school luxury better than any other train station in the West of England.

This train station is operated by Great Western Railway and has Great Western Railway train service

To get a more frequent service into Bristol temple Meads every other train stops or terminates here whilst there is then  2 hourly service to Severn Beach

the fares on this line are very cheap with Clifton Down as the mid way point - a day return at any time of the day is £3 from Bristol temple Meads all the way to Severn Beach - with the usual discounts for railcards - good value for money

There are now more conductors on the train so you will not be able to avoid paying plus also at Bristol Temple Meads you will need a ticket to get through the ticket barrier

Shelter, real time information BUT no ticket machine - buy on the train

It has two platforms - check which one especially if the train terminates there
